answers.answer: Sorry I can give you any direct answer, but I will venture the opinion that it is possible that life style changes (to me that means food diet and exercise, rest and mind control) is strong medicine.  I don't know about yoga but I have heard a lot of good things about it and I can easily imagine/believe is yoga helps settle the spirit/mind and removed anxiety it can help improve heart rhythm performance.  Still, a slow HB, expecially anything below about 35 bpm can put a person at risk of  total heart stop/failure, so one must be cautious... I think it reasonable to discuss with the attending doctor, or perhaps another heart doctor who isn't "invested" in the pacemaker business of medicine.Wishing you and your father good health,
